description.zh-cn: 位于日本东京的国立综合性研究型大学，是公认的日本最高学府。
description.en: A national comprehensive research university located in Tokyo, Japan, widely regarded as the country's most prestigious university.

description.zh-cn: 东京大学的前身之一，于1877年与东京医学校合并成立东京大学。
description.en: One of the predecessors of the University of Tokyo, which merged with the Tokyo Medical School in 1877 to form the University of Tokyo.

description.zh-cn: 东京大学的前身之一，于1877年与东京开成学校合并成立东京大学。
description.en: One of the predecessors of the University of Tokyo, which merged with the Tokyo Kaisei School in 1877 to form the University of Tokyo.

description.zh-cn: 于1886年被吸收合并入帝国大学（东京大学）。
description.en: It was absorbed and merged into the Imperial University (The University of Tokyo) in 1886.

description.zh-cn: 于1890年被吸收合并入帝国大学（东京大学）。
description.en: It was absorbed and merged into the Imperial University (The University of Tokyo) in 1890.

description.zh-cn: 于1949年被吸收合并入东京大学，变更为其教养学部。
description.en: It was absorbed and merged into the University of Tokyo in 1949, becoming its College of Arts and Sciences.

description.zh-cn: 于1949年被吸收合并入东京大学，变更为其教育学部。
description.en: It was absorbed and merged into the University of Tokyo in 1949, becoming its Faculty of Education.

en: Ministry of Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology

description.zh-cn: 日本中央省厅之一，负责教育、文化、体育、科学技术等事务。
description.en: One of the central government ministries of Japan, responsible for education, culture, sports, science, and technology.

description.zh-cn: 根据日本《国立大学法人法》设立的法人，负责管理国立大学。
description.en: A corporation established under Japan's National University Corporation Act to manage national universities.

description.zh-cn: 由日本文部科学大臣指定的，旨在达到世界最高水平的教育研究活动的国立大学法人。
description.en: A National University Corporation designated by the Minister of Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology of Japan, aiming to achieve the world's highest level of education and research activities.

description.zh-cn: 1968年至1969年间发生在东京大学的一系列学生运动，导致1969年入学考试取消。
description.en: A series of student protests at the University of Tokyo between 1968 and 1969, which led to the cancellation of the 1969 entrance examinations.

description.zh-cn: 日本工学者，现任东京大学校长。
description.en: A Japanese engineering scholar, the current president of the University of Tokyo.

description.zh-cn: 日本政治学家、教育家，曾三度担任东京大学校长。
description.en: A Japanese political scientist and educator who served as the president of the University of Tokyo three times.

description.zh-cn: 日本政治家、外交官、教育家，帝国大学（东京大学）首任校长。
description.en: A Japanese politician, diplomat, and educator, the first president of the Imperial University (The University of Tokyo).

description.zh-cn: 日本小说家，1968年诺贝尔文学奖得主，东京大学校友。
description.en: A Japanese novelist, winner of the 1968 Nobel Prize in Literature, and an alumnus of the University of Tokyo.

description.zh-cn: 日本物理学家，1973年诺贝尔物理学奖得主，东京大学校友。
description.en: A Japanese physicist, winner of the 1973 Nobel Prize in Physics, and an alumnus of the University of Tokyo.

description.zh-cn: 日本政治家，曾任内阁总理大臣，1974年诺贝尔和平奖得主，东京大学校友。
description.en: A Japanese politician who served as Prime Minister of Japan, winner of the 1974 Nobel Peace Prize, and an alumnus of the University of Tokyo.

description.zh-cn: 日本小说家，1994年诺贝尔文学奖得主，东京大学校友。
description.en: A Japanese novelist, winner of the 1994 Nobel Prize in Literature, and an alumnus of the University of Tokyo.

description.zh-cn: 日本物理学家，2002年诺贝尔物理学奖得主，东京大学校友。
description.en: A Japanese physicist, winner of the 2002 Nobel Prize in Physics, and an alumnus of the University of Tokyo.

description.zh-cn: 日裔美国物理学家，2008年诺贝尔物理学奖得主，东京大学校友。
description.en: A Japanese-American physicist, winner of the 2008 Nobel Prize in Physics, and an alumnus of the University of Tokyo.

description.zh-cn: 日本化学家，2010年诺贝尔化学奖得主，东京大学校友。
description.en: A Japanese chemist, winner of the 2010 Nobel Prize in Chemistry, and an alumnus of the University of Tokyo.

description.zh-cn: 日本物理学家，2015年诺贝尔物理学奖得主，东京大学校友。
description.en: A Japanese physicist, winner of the 2015 Nobel Prize in Physics, and an alumnus of the University of Tokyo.

description.zh-cn: 日本生物学家，2016年诺贝尔生理学或医学奖得主，东京大学校友。
description.en: A Japanese cell biologist, winner of the 2016 Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine, and an alumnus of the University of Tokyo.

description.zh-cn: 日裔美国气象学家和气候学家，2021年诺贝尔物理学奖得主，东京大学校友。
description.en: A Japanese-American meteorologist and climatologist, winner of the 2021 Nobel Prize in Physics, and an alumnus of the University of Tokyo.

description.zh-cn: 日本数学家，1954年菲尔兹奖得主，东京大学校友。
description.en: A Japanese mathematician, winner of the 1954 Fields Medal, and an alumnus of the University of Tokyo.

description.zh-cn: 与东京医学校合并成立东京大学。
description.en: Merged with the Tokyo Medical School to establish the University of Tokyo.

description.zh-cn: 与东京开成学校合并成立东京大学。
description.en: Merged with the Tokyo Kaisei School to establish the University of Tokyo.

description.zh-cn: 被吸收合并入帝国大学（东京大学）。
description.en: Was absorbed and merged into the Imperial University (The University of Tokyo).

description.zh-cn: 被吸收合并入帝国大学（东京大学）。
description.en: Was absorbed and merged into the Imperial University (The University of Tokyo).

description.zh-cn: 被吸收合并入东京大学，变更为其教养学部。
description.en: Was absorbed and merged into the University of Tokyo, becoming its College of Arts and Sciences.

description.zh-cn: 被吸收合并入东京大学，变更为其教育学部。
description.en: Was absorbed and merged into the University of Tokyo, becoming its Faculty of Education.

description.zh-cn: 成立时为文部省管辖的官立大学。
description.en: Upon its establishment, it was a government university under the jurisdiction of the Ministry of Education.

description.zh-cn: 改制为国立大学法人。
description.en: Reorganized into a National University Corporation.

description.zh-cn: 成为指定国立大学法人。
description.en: Became a Designated National University Corporation.

description.zh-cn: 受东大纷争影响，东京大学在1969年停止招生。
description.en: Due to the Todai Protests, the University of Tokyo suspended new student admissions in 1969.
